climbs.name: Walking in L.A.
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner, Sandy Lightner, Zoe and Ally, 08/06

content.description: The route climbs roughly the middle of the north face. Its a difficult flash at .12a
content.location: North face of Swift Creek Spire

climbs.name: Pull the Plug
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner, Forest Dramis, Kyle Mills, August 2006

content.description:
This is a very good limestone sport climb. The route has had only two ascents, so little bits of the surface will be breaking off (as they do on all new-dolomite/limestone climbs in the US, but after a few ascents it will be as clean as can be.

Start the route in an alcove on the southwest face. Move up and right over some loose rock for 15 feet, then onto the proper face. Climb this overhainging wall for 120 feet to the summit, passing a 15 bolts and a rap anchor (part way up) on the way.

Warning: A 70 meter rope only BARELY reaches the ground when rapping from the summit. ITs best to belay on top, lower your partner, and then do the two raps down (From top and halfway station). A 60 meter is no where near the bottom.
content.location: The southwest face of the spire.

climbs.name: Mental Hopscotch
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner, Sandy Lightner, Zoe and Ally, 08/06

content.description:
Climb up onto the ledge beneath the north face. Traverse to its far end and find an anchor. Climb the arete clipping the north face bolts.

After estaliching this free climb I found rusted studs in the arete. I believe this was the Idaho Falls Mountaineering Clubs bolt ladder. The climbed the spire via aid, then chopped the ladder on rappel. Their route continued on as "E".
content.location: North east corner of Swift Creek Spire

content.description:
This is labelled as it was the probably route of the first ascent. The spire was climbed via a bolt ladder on Mental Hopscotch and then this crack from the ledge to the summit.

Its actually a short little pitch and could be linked with one of the routes below with good rope management. The anchor on the summit is set up to send you down the southwest face.
content.protection: A few pieces of various sizes... perhaps a had size cam and a few smaller ones would suffice.
content.location: From the ledge above the north face

climbs.name: Hustler
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner, Sandy Lightner, Zoe and Ally, 08/06

content.description: AN excellent climb requiring hard overhanging pulls and delicate footwork. The route ascends the arete and face at the far right side of the north face. Its esiest to belay it from beneath the arete and not from the ledge.
content.location: North west arete of Swift Creek Spire

climbs.name: Destination Unknown
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner, Sandy Lightner, Zoe and Ally, 08/06

content.description: Route "C" in the photo, this climb is between the arete and Walking in L.A. Short people will be vertically challenged!
